snippet: As the mayor appoints the nine members of the board, which decides each year how much regulated rents will increase, tenants are counting on him to make good on a campaign promise.
abstract: New York City's renters are counting on Mayor Bill de Blasio to make good on campaign promise to have city's rent board institute its first rent freeze; are hoping that de Blasio will appoint members of the board, which decides each year how much regulated rents will increase, who will favor tenants over landlords.
lead_paragraph: As the mayor appoints the nine members of the board, which decides each year how much regulated rents will increase, tenants are counting on him to make good on a campaign promise.

headline.main: Renters Hope for Promised Freeze as de Blasio Prepares to Fill Guidelines Board
headline.print_headline: Renters Hope for Promised Freeze as de Blasio Prepares to Fill Guidelines Board
